intro: Echites dolichopetalus, commonly known as the long-petaled echites, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the stems are often hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
